title: Find the average value of a function from a graph

content.question: The regions A, B, and C in the figure above are bounded by the graph of the function <math> <mi>f</mi> </math> and the x-axis. The area of region A is 14, the area of region B is 16, and the area of region C is 50. What is the average value of <math> <mi>f</mi> </math> on the interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
